Package eventorganizer

Class EventCalendar

java.lang.Object
eventorganizer.EventCalendar
public class EventCalendar extends Object
This class manages a list/calendar of events with methods that allow for the addition, removal, and sorting and printing of the list of events ordered by criteria such as date, campus, and department.
Author:
Jason Lei, Jerlin Yuen

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find(Event event)
      Searches an event in the list events
      Parameters:
      event - - specific event
      Returns:
      x, index of the event in the list if specified event is present, NOT_FOUND (-1) if event is not present

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the capacity of the events list by 4

    • add

      public boolean add(Event event)
      Adds an event to events list
      Parameters:
      event - - specific event
      Returns:
      true if event has been added, false if event already contains the event

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Event event)
      Removes an event from events list
      Parameters:
      event - - specific event
      Returns:
      true if event has been found and removed, false if event was not found

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Event event)
      Checks events list to see if specific event is present
      Parameters:
      event - - specific event
      Returns:
      true if event is present, false if event is not present

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks events list to see if it is empty
      Returns:
      true if events list is empty, false if events list is not empty

    • print

      public void print()
      Displays "Event calendar is empty" if events list is empty, events list if events list is not empty

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      Displays "Event calendar is empty" if events list is empty, events list ordered by date and timeslot if events list is not empty

    • printByCampus

      public void printByCampus()
      Displays "Event calendar is empty" if events list is empty, events list ordered by campus and building/room if events list is not empty

    • printByDepartment

      public void printByDepartment()
      Displays each event in the events list, ordered by department "Event calendar is empty" if events list is empty, events list ordered by department if events list is not empty

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Testbed main, as the driver to test the public methods

      args - - input
